definition: to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: HanShan sitting under the cliff edge, night and day, JuShou river.
sentences.chinese: 韓珊坐在山崖下的河水邊，晝夜據守。

sentences.english: In 1945 the forts were manned by Japanese soldiers determined to hold out to the bitter end.
sentences.chinese: 這些堡壘在1945年又被日本士兵們拼死據守。
